dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Assessor's property parcel data for the Town of Tyngsborough, MA. Developed from existing digital data. Geometry and attribute data updates completed June 21, 2024, based on Assessor's August 10, 2023 FY24 extract information and Middlesex North Registry of Deeds plans.

2/2/2017 Shoreline parcel boundaries updated surrounding 47 Mascuppic Trail.

3/12/2019 Land Use Category field updated with 2019 Master Plan draft land use map categories.

2/16/2022 Land use categories updated per FY22 use codes.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: The Town of Tyngsborough; Northern Middlesex Council of Governments (NMCOG)

Consts.useLimit: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.

LegConsts.useLimit: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.
LegConsts.othConsts: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis

dataExt.exDesc: Extent in the item's coordinate system
FY2022 parcels and Assessor's data. Ground condition (based on the date of Assessor's Patriot extract). Parcels were updated 6/21/2024 through plan 250/121.

dataIdInfo.idPurp: Tyngsborough, MA, tax parcel data for the identification of property information, current land uses, and zoning.

report.measDesc: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public rights-of-way (ROWs) exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

dataSource.srcDesc: Source data included: original CAD DWG parcel boundary lines from New England Survey Service, Inc. (Boston, Mass) and Holmberg & Howe, Inc.; plans filed with the Northern Middlesex Registry of Deeds; Assessor's Patriot CAMA system extract; and 2011-2013 USGS Orthophotos.

prcStep.stepDesc: DWG files were converted to GIS computer objects using MapInfo software. Additional information obtained from land plans obtained at the town and from the Northern Middlesex Registry of deeds in order to have computer objects match the assessors tax base. Parcel boundaries have been shifted based on evidence available through orthophotos and the lack of vertical dimension of the map. File was transformed from MapInfo to ArcInfo10 for original delivery to State.

Rebuilt M301Assess from 7/16/2014 Patriot extract. Updated parcel boundary data (M301TaxPar, M301OthLeg, M301Misc) based on georeferenced plans (starting with 1/1/2010), CAD, or 2014 Pictometry orthophotos. Removed miscellaneous notes from TaxPar and OthLeg fields. Populated MAP_NO field. Added fields for tax map labeling and GIS change tracking. Added easements and ROW from CAD. Repopulated LOC_ID where necessary. Made hundreds of updates based on MassGIS QA tool v.5.2 results and topology issues. Removed all M301Misc features which matched M301TaxPar features. Added acreages to M301OthLeg features where available.

report.measDesc:
MASSGIS LEVEL 3 PARCEL QUALITY ASSURANCE TOOL (ver. 6-1) OUTPUT 20240621 ===========================================================================
# Checking match rate of assessor list to the parcels... =========================================================================== Total number of parcels in M301TaxPar = 4211 Total number of assessor records in M301Assess = 5284 (number of assessor records found where LOC_ID is NULL: 0)
HIGHER VALUE PROPERTY --------------------- Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 99.8% Number of assessor records identified where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 4636 Minimum number of these 4636 records that must link to parcels to pass QA: 4627 Actual number of these 4636 records that link to tax parcels: 4636 Observed match rate for assessor records where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL > $1000: 100.00% High value match rate passes QA.
LOWER VALUE PROPERTY -------------------- Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 97.0% Number of assessor records identified where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL < $1000: 648 Minimum number of these 648 records that must link to parcels to pass QA: 629 Actual number of these 648 records that link to tax parcels: 648 Observed match rate for assessor records where BLDG_VAL and OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 100.00% Low value match rate passes QA.
# Checking match rate of parcels to assessor list... =========================================================================== Required match rate for 4211 parcels: 99.0% Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE and NO_MATCH = "N": 4147 Minimum number of these 4147 parcels that must link to assessor records to pass QA: 4106 Actual number of these 4147 parcels that link to assessor records: 4143 Observed match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.90% Parcel to assessor match rate passes QA.
report.evalMethDesc: MassGIS Level 3 Parcel Quality Assurance Tool version 6.1

report.measDesc:
Data originally compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.
10/2018 updates utilized 2014, 2017, and 2020 Pictometry imagery which have an estimated accuracy. Horizontal accuracy: (per Absolute Horizontal Accuracies of Pictometry’s Individual Orthogonal Frame Imagery©, Pictometry Absolute Horizontal Accuracies_2014-11-21.pdf Based on testing in accordance with the procedures outlined in ASPRS Positional Accuracy Standards for Digital Geospatial Data (2014), the absolute horizontal accuracy of Pictometry’s individual orthogonal frame imagery has the following “produced to meet” horizontal accuracies at the 95% confidence interval utilizing a DEM accurate to 1 meter: 4 inch [10 cm] GSD = 3.5 feet [106 cm
2022 and 2023 (FY22, FY23, and FY24) updates are generally aligned to 2021 USGS/MassGIS 6-in resolution imagery.

overview.dsoverv: M301TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of Tyngsbourgh that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files version 2.1. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M301Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M301OthLeg and M301Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http://www.mass.gov/mgis/stratplan.html), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector.
overview.eaover:
For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1.
http://www.mass.gov/anf/research-and-tech/it-serv-and-support/application-serv/office-of-geographic-information-massgis/standards/standard-parcels.html

descript.abstract: Assessor's property parcel data for the Town of Tyngsborough, MA. Developed from existing digital data. Geometry and attribute data updates completed February 16, 2022, based on December 2, 2021, Assessor's extract information and Middlesex North Registry of Deeds plans.
descript.purpose: Tyngsborough, MA, tax parcel data for the identification of property information, current land uses, and zoning.

idinfo.accconst: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis
idinfo.useconst: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.
idinfo.datacred: The Town of Tyngsborough; Northern Middlesex Council of Governments
idinfo.native: This parcel data is submitted to MassGIS in an ArcGIS 10.9. file geodatabase. It will be incorporated into the MassGIS SDE database, and may be converted into other GIS data types for future distribution.

citeinfo.origin: Tyngsborough Office of the Board of Assessors and Town Assessor
citeinfo.title: Parcel data for Tyngsborough, MA complying with Level3 of MassGIS digital parcel standard

srcinfo.srccontr: GIS data originally digitized by NMCOG (presumably with reference to existing CAD/paper maps, though apparently not traced from CAD). NMCOG converted the data to meet MassGIS Level 3 standards in 2012. 2014 updates made by NMCOG were based on plans on file with the Northern Middlesex Registry of Deeds, CAD Assessor's map data last updated 8/14/2014 by Homberg & Howe, Inc., a MassGIS Patriot extract from 7/16/2014, and 2014 Pictometry orthophotos.

procstep.procdesc: DWG files were converted to GIS computer objects using MapInfo software. Additional information obtained from land plans obtained at the town and from the Northern Middlesex Registry of deeds in order to have computer objects match the assessors tax base. Parcel boundaries have been shifted based on evidence available through orthophotos and the lack of vertical dimension of the map. File was transformed from MapInfo to ArcInfo10 for delivery to State.

Rebuilt M301Assess from 7/16/2014 Patriot extract. Updated parcel boundary data (M301TaxPar, M301OthLeg, M301Misc) based on georeferenced plans (starting with 1/1/2010), CAD, or 2014 Pictometry orthophotos. Removed miscellaneous notes from TaxPar and OthLeg fields. Populated MAP_NO field. Added fields for tax map labeling and GIS change tracking. Added easements and ROW from CAD. Repopulated LOC_ID where necessary. Made hundreds of updates based on MassGIS QA tool v.5.2 results and topology issues. Removed all M301Misc features which matched M301TaxPar features. Added acreages to M301OthLeg features where available.

Rebuilt M301Assess from 9/3/2019 Patriot extract. Updated parcel boundary data (M301TaxPar, M301OthLeg, M301Misc) based on georeferenced plans (starting with 1/1/2010), CAD, or 2014 Pictometry orthophotos. Repopulated LOC_ID where necessary. Madeupdates based on MassGIS QA tool v.6.1 results and topology issues.

# Checking match rate of assessor list to the parcels... =========================================================================== Total number of parcels in M301TaxPar = 4207 Total number of assessor records in M301Assess = 5175 (number of assessor records found where LOC_ID is NULL: 0)

LOWER VALUE PROPERTY -------------------- Required match rate where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 97.0% Number of assessor records identified where BLDG_VAL or OTHER_VAL < $1000: 555 Minimum number of these 555 records that must link to parcels to pass QA: 539 Actual number of these 555 records that link to tax parcels: 555 Observed match rate for assessor records where BLDG_VAL and OTHER_VAL <= $1000: 100.00% Low value match rate passes QA.

dataqual.logic: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public rights-of-way (ROWs) exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

horizpa.horizpar: Original data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy over the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor. Any updates to this data have been compiled on more recent orthophotography, base maps, or digital plans.

cntorgp.cntorg: Massachusetts Office of Geographic Information, Commonwealth of Massachusetts

distinfo.resdesc: M301TaxPar represents a version of digital municipal parcels for the community of Tyngsborough, MA, that is considered ‘level 3’ compliant per the specifications outlined in the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files. Its features can be linked in a GIS or database environment to a set of standardized assessing attributes in the table M301Assess by using the unique identifying values in the LOC_ID field. This data is also intended to be used in conjunction with associated (and optional) features in the ancillary data layers M301OthLeg and M301Misc. As one of the data sets identified by Massachusetts’ Strategic Plan for Spatial Data Infrastructure (http://www.mass.gov/anf/research-and-tech/it-serv-and-support/application-serv/office-of-geographic-information-massgis/about-massgis/massgis-strategic-plan.htmll), this data enters the public domain as a valuable resource for mapping, planning, and analysis at all levels of government as well as the private sector. Developed from existing digital data.
distinfo.distliab: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.
distinfo.custom: Upon compliance with level 3 of the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files, this data will be made available for download on the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/anf/research-and-tech/it-serv-and-support/application-serv/office-of-geographic-information-massgis/datalayers/l3parcels.html
